Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இழிவறிந்து உண்பான்கண் இன்பம்போல் நிற்குங் கழிபேர் இரையான்கண் நோய்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: As pleasure dwells with him who eats moderately, so disease (dwells) with the glutton who eats voraciously.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition. On the left, a person is eating with moderation, understanding the right, small amount ('இழிவறிந்து உண்பான்'). A beautiful, graceful figure of Joy ('இன்பம்') is shown residing with them.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, a glutton ('கழிபேர் இரையான்') is eating voraciously and excessively. A hideous, monstrous figure of Disease ('நோய்') is shown taking up residence in their body.
Layered_Composition.Background: The moderate eater's life is bright and happy. The glutton's life is dark and full of suffering. Pleasure stays with one, disease stays with the other.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Joy resides with the moderate eater; disease resides with the glutton.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of Joy as a beautiful companion and Disease as a hideous monster is the central concept. This clearly shows who lives with whom.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Contrasting, pleasant vs. painful, healthy vs. sick.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The left side is bright, warm, and full of pleasant colors. The right side is dark, sickly, and full of grotesque colors.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A side-by-side shot that makes the two outcomes and their companions clear.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with strong character design for the personified Joy and Disease.
